alert.note: Alert for Shelby (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 4:47PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern DeSoto, northwestern Marshall and southeastern Shelby Counties through 515 PM CDT... At 447 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Memphis, or 7 miles northeast of T O Fuller State Park, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Southaven, Collierville, Germantown, Olive Branch, Memphis, Southeast Memphis, Downtown Memphis, Southwest Memphis, Lewisburg, Whitehaven, Midtown Memphis, Piperton, Fairhaven, Cedarview, Parkway Village, White Station, Handy Corner, Capleville, Miller and Plum Point. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for eastern Arkansas...northwestern Mississippi...and west Tennessee.
